title: SatixFy sells satellite payload subsidiary to MDA
summary: Israeli satcoms equipment maker SatixFy announced plans Aug. 31 to sell its satellite payload subsidiary to MDA as part of a $60 million strategic transaction with the Canadian space hardware specialist.

title: SpaceX to conduct second launch for Space Development Agency’s Tranche 0 and Starlink mission
summary: SpaceX will launch a batch of 13 communications and missile tracking satellites from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base on the Tranche 0 Flight 2 mission for the Space Development Agency (SDA). The flight is scheduled on Thursday, Aug. 31, 2023, with the 59-minute-long launch window opening at 7:26 AM PDT (14:26 UTC). If needed there is a backup opportunity at the same time on Friday. Shortly after SpaceX will attempt to launch its Starlink Group 6-13 mission.

title: NASA gears up for return of OSIRIS-REx asteroid sample
summary: NASA is making the final preparations to recover samples from an asteroid that a spacecraft will bring back to Earth in September.

title: Chinese study finds GSSAP close approaches a threat to its GEO assets
summary: Chinese researchers have noted close approaches by U.S. GSSAP satellites to Chinese spacecraft in the geostationary belt, describing the activities as threats.

title: “Asteroid Autumn” Begins Next Month With OSIRIS-REx Asteroid Sample Return
summary: In a preview today of the imminent return of samples from the asteroid Bennu, NASA declared the next few months as “Asteroid Autumn.” The OSIRIS-REx spacecraft is just one of […]

title: Spiral Blue offers to run Your Code in Space
summary: Australian startup Spiral Blue is inviting developers and researchers to run custom code on the company’s SE-1 computer on a Satellogic satellite in low-Earth orbit.

title: Firefly Officially "On Call" For US Space Force Responsive Space Launch Demo
summary: In a significant stride towards advancing rapid-response space missions, Firefly Aerospace and Millennium Space Systems have announced they are ready and awaiting instructions from the U.S. Space Force to initiate the launch of a satellite.

title: NASA Completes Last OSIRIS-REx Test Before Asteroid Sample Delivery
summary: A team led by NASA in Utah’s West Desert is in the final stages of preparing for the arrival of the first U.S. asteroid sample – slated to land on Earth in September.

title: NASA Deep Space Network Critically Overworked & Underfunded
summary: NASA's Deep Space Network (DSN) is a critical system that allows communication with spacecraft exploring our solar system and the cosmos,but it is facing an unprecedented strain due to a perfect storm of increased demand and diminishing financial resources.

title: NASA Awards Contracts for NOAA Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications Study
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), has awarded four contracts to conduct NOAA’s Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications (SMBA) Phase-A study.
